column9: I use this medication for occasional poison ivy and oak outbreaks and it does the trick for me relieving itching and spreading of the rash. I also use it in conjunction with Tecnu poison ivy and oak oil remover soap. Works great!

Traci S., 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This is the only medication that has brought me relief! It has dramatically improved the appearance of the skin on the back of my neck and chest where I suffer from atopic dermatitis. My doctor prescribed the desoximetasone along with another topical drug, but I have only renewed the prescription for desox. because of how effective it was. I would strongly recommend this for anyone coping with a similar skin condition.

column2: felinecharms, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: So far so good!  I have had trouble with my hands for about 2 years now and this last month has been awful.  Cracking and bleeding they had gotton so tight and swollen I couldn't hardly move them.  I have had 3 shots of steriods and numerous lactic acid lotions that burned like fire.  But this was immeadiate releaf.  I hopw it keeps working or I would have had to quit my job.

column2: 25-34 (Patient)
column9: I contracted poison ivy (I am VERY allergic)& my doctor prescribed this for me. I am extremely cautious with medicine and I hesitated to use it after reading some reviews but I am 100% happy that I used this. Within 24 hours my rash is almost gone. I have had ZERO side effects! Until yesterday, my rash was still weeping and spreading but thanks to this, I am almost healed.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This medicine helped my eczema a lot, however, it came with a very unfortunate side effect: stretch marks. I have them behind my left knee and on my thighs. I switched to another doctor and she gave me a new medicine. To this day, the stretch marks have not gone away and I'm not sure they ever will. It's really very unfortunate.

column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this medication because after surgery I developed atopic dermatitis on my feet. My dermatologist tried many medications and nothing helped for more then a few days. I saw my foot doctor and he prescribed this immediately. It took a few weeks to start working, but as long as I remember to use it now, I rarely ever have any itching on my feet. It's the only long term medication I've used that's done any good.

column2: Sunere_62, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My Dermotologist has me using for only two weeks, but after two weeks, I've only seen a little improvement. Perhaps it takes more two weeks, Time will tell.

column2: Meghan, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I used this medicine for severe eczema on my legs and stomach. At first I had great results with this medicine. It got rid of some major spots. I kept using it for my normal breakouts for a couple of years. I know have learned that it caused weight gain and stretch marks. I decided to go to a new doctor who said he would never let anyone take this medicine for more than six weeks! I might never get rid of these nasty stretch marks but since I stopped taking the med I have lost 15 pounds, without trying. I do not recommend taking this medicine for extended use. Anyone can have these side effects.

column2: mysticpc, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: More than once I have had an episode of contact dermatitis. I experience extreme intense itching, rednes, severe swelling, irritation with red raised bumps and welps on my arm. Using desoximetasone 0.25% cream is the only cream that works for me. I experience almost immediately relief and I continue to use it until there is no sign of the rash. I highly recommend this to anyone!!!!!
